intro: Salvia exilis, commonly known as slender sage, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a grayish-green hue. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Salvia exilis is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
